document.masterDocTitle: Scale insects (Hemiptera: Coccoidea) associated with avocado crop, Persea americana Mill. (Lauraceae) in Valle del Cauca and neighboring departments of Colombia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Scale insects (Hemiptera: Coccoidea) associated with avocado crop, Persea americana Mill. (Lauraceae) in Valle del Cauca and neighboring departments of Colombia

Distribution. Afrotropical: Comoros , Mauritius , Reunion, South Africa , Zimbabwe . Nearctic: USA . Neotropical: Argentina , Bermuda , Chile , Colombia , Costa Rica , Cuba , Dominican Republic , Grenada , Guadeloupe, Guatemala , Guyana , Haiti , Jamaica , Martinique, Mexico , Peru , Puerto Rico , Saint Lucia , Trinidad , U.S. Virgin Islands . Oriental: Taiwan , Vietnam . Palaearctic: Azores, Canary Islands, Crete, France , Greece , Israel , Italy , Japan , Madeira Islands, Malta , Portugal , Spain ( Ben-Dov et al. 2015 ).

Remarks. The species was found on the underside of leaves of ‘Booth 8’, ‘Lorena’, ‘Santana’ and ‘Trinidad’ cultivars.
Protopulvinaria pyriformis
was one of the most common soft scales on avocado in the studied area. It was found associated with sootymolds in trees with high populations of the insect. In the field, larvae of a species of Syrphidae were observed feeding on the soft scales.
